Q: What problems are you trying to solve in your day-to-day work?
A: Our biggest pain point is honestly repetitive communication and information management. Every day, we're answering the same questions from clients about property details, financing options, neighborhood information—and that falls on different team members who might give slightly different answers. We also spend tons of time manually pulling data from multiple systems and creating custom property reports for clients, which is incredibly time-consuming and error-prone.

Q: How do you currently handle property information delivery and client onboarding?
A: It's pretty manual right now, I'll be honest. Our agents are creating custom email responses, pulling data from our MLS system, and putting together PDFs using templates in Word. Some agents use our CRM, but not all of them consistently. For client onboarding, we have a standard checklist that goes out via email, but there's no personalization based on what type of property they're looking at or their specific situation. We definitely lose some clients in the process because the experience feels generic and clunky.

Q: Have you used any AI tools before? What was your experience?
A: Yeah, we've dabbled with ChatGPT for content creation and a couple of marketing teams have used some basic automation tools. The experience was mixed—we found ChatGPT helpful for brainstorming and drafting emails, but it required a lot of manual tweaking to sound like it was actually from our team. None of these tools integrated well with our existing systems, so we ended up doing more work managing the integration than we saved. It felt like a patchwork solution rather than something built for our specific workflow.

Q: What are your biggest concerns or reservations about adopting AI?
A: My main concern is data security and privacy—we handle sensitive financial information and client data, so I need to be 100% certain that any tool we use isn't putting that at risk. I'm also worried about the learning curve and whether our team will actually embrace it or just go back to doing things the old way. And honestly, I'm a bit skeptical about whether AI can really understand the nuances of real estate—like local market knowledge and personalized client relationships that feel authentic, not robotic.

Q: If you could wave a magic wand, what would your ideal AI solution do?
A: I'd want something that could create personalized property presentations and client communications automatically based on client profiles and property details. It would pull from our MLS data, our CRM, and maybe even public data about neighborhoods, and then generate customized email sequences, property summaries, and follow-up prompts that actually sound like they're coming from a real person. And it would integrate seamlessly with our existing tools so our agents don't have to jump between platforms.

Q: How much time do you estimate AI could save you per week?
A: If we could automate even 30% of the communication work, I'd estimate we're looking at about 15-20 hours a week across the team—that's just the time spent writing and customizing client emails and preparing property information packets. We have five support people who could potentially be freed up to focus on more valuable activities like actually building relationships with clients or handling complex negotiations. That would be transformational for our operation.

Q: Walk me through your decision-making process for adopting new tools.
A: First, I usually run it by my leadership team and get buy-in on the problem we're trying to solve. Then I insist on a solid trial period where a subset of our team can test it with real workflows—no theoretical exercises. I need to see ROI within the first 30-45 days, and I need feedback from actual users, not just managers. After that, I look at cost relative to time saved and make a decision, then create an implementation plan with training and accountability. We can't afford to buy something and have it collect dust.

Q: What would make you choose one AI platform over another?
A: Honestly, deep integration with our existing systems is huge—we use Salesforce, our MLS provider's software, and a couple of other tools, so I need something that plays well with those. Customer support is critical too, because when something breaks, I need to know we can get help quickly. I also really value transparency around how the AI works and what it's doing with our data. And I'll be upfront—ease of use for our team matters a lot. If it's too complicated, it won't get adopted.

Q: What's your budget range for a solution like this?
A: We're looking at somewhere between $5,000 and $15,000 per month depending on what we're getting. I know that seems like a range, but it really depends on whether this is a nice-to-have or a must-have, and how many users we'd be rolling out to. If it can genuinely save us that 15-20 hours a week I mentioned, we'd be willing to invest at the higher end. ROI has to make sense though—I need to be able to justify it to the CFO.

Q: Who else would need to be involved in the decision?
A: Definitely our VP of Sales and our IT Director—sales because this directly impacts how our agents work with clients, and IT because of the security and integration concerns. I'd probably also want to loop in one or two of our top agents to get their perspective on what would actually help them in the field. And of course, the CFO needs to sign off on the budget. We've learned the hard way that you can't just implement something without team input, or adoption will fail.

Q: On a scale of 1-10, how critical is this problem to solve?
A: I'd give it an 8 out of 10. It's not an emergency—we're surviving with our current process—but it's a real efficiency drain and I genuinely think it's costing us deals because our client experience doesn't feel as polished as larger firms. We're also losing good people to burnout because they're doing so much repetitive work. If we could solve this, it would be a competitive advantage and let us scale without just adding more headcount.

Q: What do you love most about our product and what needs improvement?
A: What really impressed us in the demo was how customizable it is—we can actually train it on our messaging and data, which means it won't sound generic like most AI tools do. The fact that you built it specifically for real estate use cases shows that someone understands our pain points. If I'm being critical, I'd say we need more clarity on the onboarding process and whether you can help us migrate our historical data. I'd also love to see some case studies from other real estate firms your size so we can see what kinds of results are realistic.
